alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Martin County through 400 PM EDT... At 329 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Port Salerno, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stuart, Jupiter Island, Hobe Sound, Port Salerno and Sewall`s Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
